attributes.action: Regulate animal rescue centres.
attributes.background:
Animal rescue centres are currently not regulated. This means that anyone can open as a rescue centre.
 
Regulation would allow for rules and guidelines to be issued and regular visits made to inspect that there is at minimum no breach of the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Remove rip-off compound interest from student loans
attributes.background: Student loans charge a huge 6.1% interest, even during study. Worse, the 6.1% is compounded monthly, meaning interest is added to the loans every month, making loans bigger, so the next month the interest costs even more; the loans get bigger and interest costs increase every month. It is a rip-off.
attributes.additional_details: Even though the base rate is only 0.25%, students are exploited by horrendous 6.1% interest, compounded monthly, being charged on their loans – this can double or treble the size of the loans and massively increase interest costs, too. Most ‘normal’ loans do not do this. It is exploitative. No wonder student loans get bigger even while borrowers are paying off their loans. Sign the petition to remove interest from student loans. More info. here: https://www.afairdealforstudents.com/

attributes.action: Reduce the age of Breast Screening to 25-30
attributes.background:
I was diagnosed with breast cancer age 36, at 37 I was told it was terminal. I have a 8 year old daughter who has already lost her dad to heart disease. Because of my age, I never dreamt I'd have breast cancer
Cancer does not discriminate!
Help our kids get diagnosed quicker to prevent early death
attributes.additional_details:
I know of a huge amount of women/men diagnosed with breast cancer between the age of 23-40 most are now terminally ill and leaving children & babies behind. 
I want everyone to have a better chance of survival; not only for themselves, but for their children, parents, siblings, friends.

Cancer does not discriminate, it doesn't care how old or fit you are or whether you're male or female, so why are mandatory mammograms only available for women 50+

attributes.action: Investigate whether David Davis lied to Parliament about Impact Assessments
attributes.background:
David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out impact reports detailing the financial impact of Brexit on the UK economy.

However these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2016, Secretary of State for Exiting the EU David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out “about 57 sets of analyses”. These would detail the financial impact of Brexit on sectors vital to the UK economy.
 
On 6th December 2017, David Davis admitted that these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.

attributes.action: Save our pets from death on the roads Don't Ban Containment Systems
attributes.background: The Government has started a consultation on banning electronic training aids for cats and dogs. It is vital that containment systems do not get caught up in any ban. These systems save the lives of thousands of cats and dogs each year. Over 250,000 cats & countless dogs are run over on our roads.
attributes.additional_details: In 2007 DEFRA commissioned a study into the use of Electronic Pulse Training Aids. This study specifically excluded containment fences. The highly regarded Companion Animal Welfare Council's in-depth study of June 2012 concluded that it was not possible to formulate an evidence-based argument against the use of Electric Pulse Training Aids (EPTAs). In 2016 research from Lincoln University into cat containment "No evidence of long-term welfare problems with electronic containment of cats"

attributes.action: Make Transplant patients Exempt from paying prescription charges
attributes.background: I have recently learnt after going to renew my exemption certificate that Transplant patients are not exempt despite the amount of drugs they have to take for this life threatening illness. I feel this is wrong when other illnesses such as diabetes are exempt.

attributes.action: We ask the Government to commit to the UK's continued participation in Erasmus
attributes.background: Questions have been raised about the UK's continued involvement in Erasmus because of Brexit. The Government should provide immediate clarity and commit now to seeking continued and full UK participation in Erasmus.
attributes.additional_details:
Questions have been raised about the UK's continued involvement in Erasmus because of Brexit, see various press articles: 
https://www.timeshighereducation.com/blog/uk-students-may-be-barred-erasmus-after-brexit 
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2017/feb/07/a-students-plea-to-brexit-negotiators-keep-the-erasmus-scheme 

Erasmus opportunities should be available for future generations.

attributes.action: Dogs under S1 DDA should automatically be entitled to interim exemption
attributes.background: The Dangerous Dogs Act (s1) prohibits ownership of certain dogs. Any dog suspected to be a banned breed it is likely to be seized by the police and kept in a police kennel. If the court finds the dog is a banned breed but it is not deemed a danger, it may be exempted (subject to restrictions).
attributes.additional_details: The police have the power to issue an interim exemption pending the courts decision. However, this is entirely at their discretion and how this is dealt with varies between forces. Where a dog is only being pursued as a result of how they look, this interim exemption should be automatic (where the restrictions can be put in place and adhered to). Spending long periods in kennels can detrimental to the welfare of a dog and the owner.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of live small animals in pet shops and garden centres in the UK
attributes.background: Shops should no longer be allowed to sell living creatures. It is too easy for people to make rash decisions & impulse buy animals when they're displayed like products. If the animals weren't on display, people would have to do more research & seek out a breeder or rescue for their new pet.
attributes.additional_details: Animals sold in shops or garden centres are most at risk of abandonment or left to charities. When sold to anyone who can pay, this can result in unprepared, incompetent, or abusive owners. Often stored out of sight, these animals are kept in small crates with little space or care. Animals are often depressed, mis-sexed, sick, or injured.  Leading to unexpected litters & vet bills, while animals when bought for children or as a gift on a special occasion, are often given up or abandoned.

attributes.action: Make the teaching of Sexual consent  compulsory In schools
attributes.background:
Rape, Sexual abuse and harassment are prevalent issues effecting our society. 

More needs to be done to tackle these issues. Children need to be taught what constitutes consentual sex and what actions are considered Sexual abuse and harassment as part of the compulsory national curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
The teaching of consent in schools is currently not compulsory. 

85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year

1 in 5 women aged 16 - 59 has experienced some form of sexual violence since. 

Some references:
https://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/mar/09/sexual-consent-lessons-government-criticised-pshea-inadequate

attributes.action: Insist all supermarkets sell plastic free alternatives for all products sold
attributes.background: Our world is being destroyed by plastic, with up 90% of sea birds alone having been found to have plastic in their guts. We can only begin to imagine the devastation plastic is having on the rest of the marine life, including fish that end up on peoples plates.
attributes.additional_details: We are all responsible, yet I feel our supermarkets have a the biggest responsibility to save our world. I feel it should be a legal obligation that all supermarkets offer plastic free, eco friendly alternatives to ALL their products so shoppers are given choice. At present the only option in most supermarkets is plastic, plastic and more plastic. This HAS to stop. Please sign this petition to ask the government to make it a legal requirement that all supermarkets have plastic free alternatives.

attributes.action: Tongue Tie to be recognised and made a compulsory check on Newborn Babies.
attributes.background: Tongue Tie can affect around 4-11% of newborns and it's a malformation which restricts the movement of the tongue. It can cause difficulties from a young age and as they grow.  It can cause mothers issues around breastfeeding or terminate breastfeeding like in our case.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son is 15 weeks old had tongue tie up until very recently where we gave in and had a private consultation to have his Tongue Tie divided due to it causing him problems. His bibs were saturated, hasn't gained much weight, couldn't latch onto the teat and pooling milk in his mouth and not swallowing for several sucks. 
It can cause speech & dental problems and the inability to chew solid foods as well as emotional factors. It can cause mums problems like sore/cracked nipples, low milk supply and mastitis. Unfortunately it went unrecognised for 15 weeks in our case even though we pointed it out. It takes just a few seconds to snip and would potentially reduce the amount of appointments and referrals if dealt with early on.
Reference: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/tongue-tie/

attributes.action: Lift the UK Travel Ban to Sharm el Sheikh
attributes.background: The UK remains one of the only countries in Europe to still have a travel ban to Sharm. This should now be lifted. Egypt has a 'high' terror threat, along with other countries such as Australia, France, Thailand etc. British holiday makers are still able to travel to these countries.
attributes.additional_details: The Egypt officials have done everything the British government has asked of them. They have spent over £20 million on security (hiring British security firms). The British public are still travelling to Sharm el Sheikh by joining connecting flights from Germany, France as well as Cairo . Most European countries have now lifted their travel ban, except for the UK. This ban is damaging the UK and Egypt tourism industry, the government lift the ban to Tunisia after sousse attack, so why not Sharm.

attributes.action: Introduce interim “pub cap” and a full review of the business rate system
attributes.background: Pubs in St Albans and parts of England have been hit with extortionate business rate increases due to property values increasing over the past decade. We believe there needs to be a fundamental review on the business rate system to stop pubs disappearing from our villages, towns and cities.
attributes.additional_details: We are calling for an immediate interim "Pub Cap" limiting increases in rates bills to 12.5% in England (currently operating in Scotland) and a fundamental review of the whole system to ensure that pubs can survive and this British community asset will not be lost forever.

attributes.action: Brexit: Stop using ‘will of the people’ and ‘will of the British people.’
attributes.background: Government ministers are perpetrating a falsehood when advancing its affairs as ‘the will of the people’ or ‘the will of the British people’; taking its authority to use these expressions from the result of the EU advisory referendum of June 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
In the 2016 referendum, the Electoral Commission recorded the following:
Total electorate: 46,500,001
Voted Leave : 17,410,742
Voted Remain: 16,141,241
Rejected Ballots: 25,350
On the basis of these figures, the government in expressing the will of 17,410,742 members of the electorate as ‘the will of the people’ or ‘ the will of the British people’ is publishing a falsity when 29,089,259 members of the electorate did NOT vote to leave the European Union.

attributes.action: Make Work Related Stress  absence over 7 days reportable under RIDDOR 2013
attributes.background: Work related stress is the most reported injury between workers. I would love to see all absence for work related stress reported to the HSE under the Reporting of Injuries,Diseases and Dangerous Occurrences Regulation 2013. Make stress an occupational disease, make stress RIDDOR 2013 reportable
attributes.additional_details: 12.5 million working days lost due to work - related stress, depression or anxiety in 2016/17 sourced information from HSE....so much productivity lost

attributes.action: Make the wearing of cycle helmets for children law.
attributes.background: Wearing my cycle helmet saved my life! It protected my head when I hit the road and from the hot exhaust when I was trapped under the car. The helmet was amazing as it was damaged and melted but still intact. Now I want all children to have to wear helmets.
attributes.additional_details:
My accident happened while cycling to school. I came off my bike head first, landing in front of a car, which drove over me, trapping me beneath. The air ambulance attended and I was flown to hospital. I sustained three breaks, a fracture and lost some teeth. 

The consultant said I wouldn't have survived without a helmet.  

I want you all to understand it can happen to anyone....as it happened to me!

attributes.action: For 'Singing on Prescription' to be adopted by the NHS
attributes.background: A growing body of research has found that singing with other people has a positive impact on the health and wellbeing of participants whilst also being a great way to meet and bond with other people, thereby reducing loneliness and isolation, particularly in older people.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.canterbury.ac.uk/health-and-wellbeing/sidney-de-haan-research-centre/documents/singing-for-mental-health-report-dec-2015.pdf
http://rsos.royalsocietypublishing.org/content/2/10/150221
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11811096?access_num=11811096&link_type=MED&dopt=Abstract
http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/1321103X13478862

attributes.action: Formally recognize Jerusalem as the capital city of Israel
attributes.background: Given the recent statement from the President of the USA, now would be a good opportunity for the UK to join the USA in recognizing Jerusalem as the Israeli Capital. To resolve the Palestine-Israel issue the UK Gov't must take steps which will pressure both sides to enter into proper negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
Statement by President Donald Trump - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-42259443

Prime Minister May's statement against recognizing Jerusalem as the Israeli Capital - https://www.gov.uk/government/news/pm-statement-on-us-decision-to-move-embassy-to-jerusalem-6-december-2017

Prime Minister Netanyahu's Response to President Donald Trump's Statement -http://www.pmo.gov.il/English/MediaCenter/Spokesman/Pages/spoke_statement061217.aspx

attributes.action: Provide short term emergency parking stickers for IBD sufferers.
attributes.background: I’m trying to be a voice for sufferers of Crohn’s and Colitis which are the two forms of inflammatory bowel disease. One of the main symptoms is an urgent need to use the toilet which, due to general poor accessibility to public toilets can often results in unnecessary incontinence.

attributes.action: Specialist provision for children/adults with Foetal Alcohol Spetrum Disorder
attributes.background: There are thousands of children in the UK who have been diagnosed with Foetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder. Most are being failed by the NHS system, as there are no specialist FASD teams providing proper care.  Many don't fulfil criteria for CAMHS/Paediatric services so have no ongoing care in place.
attributes.additional_details: FASD is a hidden disability that leaves children & young people vulnerable.  The NHS are frequently at a loss to know how to support this condition, with many children & parents left to fend for themselves.  Holistic specialised team for FASD families are needed, with specialised interest in working together to provide therapies and behavioural plans, including psychology, OT, sleep, medical, SALT, trauma, attachment & neurobehavioral (on the lines of Nate Sheets in Oregan).

attributes.action: Reject HS2 Phase 2a proposed scheme to save Blithbury Reindeer Lodge
attributes.background: Blithbury Reindeer Lodge will be severely affected or face closure due to the current HS2 phase 2a proposed scheme.
attributes.additional_details: Blithbury Reindeer Lodge was set up by Mr Swinnerton in 2007.  Under the current scheme, the lodge would be affected by a purchase of land and the relocation of the B5014. All the land is utilized for grazing and relocation is not an option. Realignment of the road will cause disruption, noise and air pollution. If the land is acquired the lodge will have no option but to close.

attributes.action: Introduce photo ID cards in order to vote in all Elections.
attributes.background:
We believe that photo ID cards should be mandatory in order to be able to vote in all Elections.
In order to prevent voter fraud, the Government should introduce a national photo ID scheme. 
Government would pay for the ID cards. 
This would mean the cards would be free to any voter.
attributes.additional_details: The application form would be available to complete on  the Government website.

attributes.action: Ban British citizens from serving in the Israeli military
attributes.background: There are currently many British citizens serving in the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF). The UK government should ban UK citizens – even if they hold other passports – from joining and serving in the Israeli military, police or other security forces.
attributes.additional_details: The Israeli military routinely commits acts which many experts believe, under international law, constitute war crimes - including occupying Palestinian territory; torturing suspects; bombing Palestinian schools, hospitals, and water plants; and conducting collective punishments of civilians - all of which are unlawful in international law. No UK citizens should be allowed to possibly contribute to further war crimes by serving in the Israeli military, police or security apparatus.

attributes.action: Put Stonehenge into special measures Remove Stonehenge from EH Management
attributes.background: Since splitting with Historic England, English Heritage has commercialized Stonehenge to the extreme introducing a 'Pay to Pray' Policy at Solstices and priced Tourism out of reach for the General Public to whom it was left, and supported unsuitable road improvements in the World Heritage site.
attributes.additional_details: They have rejected the advice and concerns of UNESCO, Senior Archaeologists, Historians, Druids, and Environmentalists. This shows they are not fit to manage the 'Jewel in the Crown' of a World Heritage site.

attributes.action: Reinstate sailing and windsurfing to A level and GCSE PE
attributes.background: Recently sailing and windsurfing have been taken off the list of sports you can be marked on for GCSE and A level PE. Some people started this course unaware of this change.
attributes.additional_details: Sailing and Windsurfing should be reinstated as you have to be physically fit to compete, you can race and it involves refining technique to do well. The UK is an island which mean there are plenty of places for young people to participate in these activities.

attributes.action: Actively prepare for a no-deal brexit & tell the EU: 'fair deal, or no deal'
attributes.background:
It's now 1 year 4 months since Britain voted to LEAVE the EU. The EU's negotiators show no willingness to offer us a fair deal. The practical way forward, to fulfill the Referendum decision, is therefore to actively prepare to leave WITHOUT a deal, moving to World Trade 
Organisation rules ASAP.
attributes.additional_details:
The case FOR 'No Deal': 
1 We'll be free to strike our OWN trade deals with others
2 We'll be free of all EU entanglements 
3 If we leave with no deal, we owe them NOTHING. There's no legal mechanism for the EU to recover a penny from us after 29 March 2019 
4 We'll be free to control our own borders
5 We'll be free from European Court of Justice jurisdiction 
6 If they threaten loss of access to their market, we must simply  threaten the same to them. They sell more to us than we do to them

attributes.action: Make the maximum wait for CAMHS assesments no more than 6 months.
attributes.background:
Currently the wait to get a child assesed for autism is almost 1.5 years
This is not acceptable and can have serious implications on the child's mental health, as well as causing serious problems within the home. This petition is to try and persuade the government to reduce these waiting times.
attributes.additional_details: Waiting times are taken from friends currently on the waiting list in Warwickshire.

attributes.action: The MCA must send launch request to RNLI when fishing boats are reported overdue
attributes.background:
Fishing is the UK's most dangerous peacetime occupation. The Marine & Coastguard Agency must immediately task RNLI lifeboats when 
1) A fishing vessel is reported overdue by a harbour or family member. 2) A distress signal is received.
attributes.additional_details: Any delay in the MCA tasking the RNLI can mean the difference of life and death for a fisherman. There is not an RNLI crew in the country that would mind being called to station to launch, only later to be stood down because all is well with a vessel. A change of protocol to require the MCA to immediately task the local RNLI crews is needed urgently. Worse things happen at sea and even short delays can mean the difference between the rescue of a survivor, or the recovery of a body.

attributes.action: Petition to Establish Evidence-Based Treatment for Eating Disorders in U.K.
attributes.background: Eating Disorders have the highest mortality rate of any psychiatric illness, yet in practice, therapy protocols do not reflect evidence-based care as recommended by the National Institute for Care Excellence (NICE).

attributes.action: Ban non biodegradable plastic in food/drink packaging. Switch to hemp plastic.
attributes.background: Most drink bottles, tubs and other food packaging are made from petroleum based plastic. This is are toxic to the environment and takes 1000's of years (if ever) to break down. It is polluting the oceans and soil. Eco friendly biodegradable hemp plastic exists but is currently not being used.
attributes.additional_details:
Every week we (in the UK) bury 1000's of tonnes of plastic food and drink packaging. 
More makes its way into the rivers and oceans. It causes massive pollution harming both us and wildlife.
There is an environmentally friendly alternative. Hemp based plastic exists, but at the moment it is not used. 
Mostly because it is not well known about and there is no major manufacturing of it like there is for petroleum based plastics.
For our health and the environment we should make its use mandatory.

attributes.action: Ban or reduce the excessive brightness of LED or HID high intensity car lights
attributes.background:
Car head lights are now so bright that it's hard to see driving in the dark because you get blinded by the oncoming cars with high intensity discharge (hid) or led driving lights.
The law needs to be changed to greatly reduce the brightness.

attributes.action: Extend the review of PIP claims to all claims & the PIP decision making process
attributes.background:
This week a review of PIP Claims was announced in response to a High Court ruling that the clause 'for reasons other than psychological distress' into the Mobility Component was 'blatant discrimination'.
But, my experience is that the entire system needs review - individual decisions & the process
attributes.additional_details:
While I applaud the decision that claims will be reviewed following the High Court ruling, the flaws in the PIP system go further than the in-built discrimination against Mental Health Disabilities.
My experience is that those with Physical and Learning Disabilities are also discriminated against, & subject to flawed decisions.
The fact that over 65% of PIP decisions are overturned at Tribunal in favour of the Claimant demonstrates this clearly.
PIP needs to be reviewed in its entirety.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of White poppies alongside the British Legion red poppy campaign.
attributes.background: Ban the sale of white poppies in November, alongside the RBL Campaign as it is nothing more than a political move that detracts from the good work the legion do and make a mockery of the official remembrance campaign and those that gave their lives for this country.
attributes.additional_details: The white poppy campaign states that it remembers all war dead, which would include civilians and enemy combatants. Not just the enemy of old, but also the despicable fighters from groups like ISIL, who advocate rape and torture. While there is no issue with remembering more than just British Forces personnel who have given their lives, there is a great issue with doing this alongside the official campaign. The white poppy should only be sold at other times of the year.

attributes.action: Allow parents to legally withdraw their child from SATs (NC tests).
attributes.background: Parents should be able to legally withdraw their child from SATs, if they recognise that their child is suffering from the detrimental effects of SATs, or that they simply do not want to subject their child to the unnecessary stress associated with such testing.
attributes.additional_details:
SATs at the end of a child's primary education serve no purpose other than to provide data with which to show a primary school's 'worth', and also perhaps on which secondary schools can base their unrealistic targets for GCSE grades. 
However, subjecting 10 and 11 year olds to such punitive testing is highly stressful and can be hugely demoralising. It has been reported that year 6 pupils have been known to suffer from insomnia and other stress-related conditions. Parents should have the choice.

attributes.action: Save the NHS - Stop the underfunding and skill shortages
attributes.background: We the undersigned believe current Government policy is creating a crisis in the NHS, which is the countries most valued institution.
attributes.additional_details: We demand HM Government implements the following 5 steps to save the NHS. a) Add all NHS job roles to the Shortage Occupation list to ensure full staffing. b) Cease all future outsourcing of core functionality to 3rd parties. c) Increase the pitiful recent settlement to the full £350m per week promised in the referendum. d) If increase funding is not readily available stop brexit and spend that wasted money on the NHS instead. e) Introduce Legislation to exclude any foreign government or companies involvement in the NHS, especially as part of any post Brexit trade deal.

attributes.action: Aesthetic medicine treatments only to be performed by Doctors, Nurses & Dentists
attributes.background: Everyday we are hearing horror stories involving inexperienced and unqualified people administering medical treatments such as botox, derma fillers etc. There is a need to regulate the aesthetic medicine industry finally.

attributes.action: Raise Statutory Sick Pay for Cancer suffers to minimal wage& extend to 52 weeks.
attributes.background: No person within the UK diagnosed with Cancer should be put into financial difficulties by a large reduction of their income due to Cancer. In some instances, an employer may have a 4 or 8-week full Company sick pay, but after this time, their income drops to the current Statutory Sick Pay.
attributes.additional_details: I am currently employed by a one of the largest UK High street retailers and diagnosed with Cancer on the 15th Sept 2017. On the 2nd Oct (36 hours before I had Cancer surgery), my employer sat me down & informed me that I would NOT be getting paid while I was off recovering from Cancer. I have received my examples through Social Media of similar practices by this employer and by many other UK companies

attributes.action: Make medicinal cannabis legal for long term mental/physical health conditions
attributes.background: I have had cerebral palsy since birth and suffer with chronic pain and stiffness every day causing a very limited life. Now being housebound, I would love your help to enjoy life and I believe medicinal cannabis (high cbd/low thc) could help control/relieve symptoms for many health conditions.
attributes.additional_details: Medical cannabis, or medical marijuana, is cannabis and cannabinoids that are recommended by doctors for their patients.The use of cannabis as a medicine has not been rigorously tested due to production restrictions and other governmental regulations. Evidence suggests cannabis can: reduce nausea and vomiting during chemotherapy, improve appetite in people with HIV/AIDS, help with anxiety/depression and reduce chronic pain and muscle spasms.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland to host a second referendum for Scottish Independence.
attributes.background: During the first referendum the Scottish public were presented with a number of promises from the Westminster government in the case of a No vote. These promises have since either been broken or forgotten. As a direct result we the undersigned demand a second referendum on independence.
attributes.additional_details:
Broken Promises.
.We were told we would remain in the EU - Despite voting to stay we're leaving. 
.Extensive new powers for the Scottish Parliament - Westminster wishes to now strip powers from Scotland.
.Continuation of the Barnett Formula - There are now talks of cutting Scotland's budget further.
.Work was promised for the shipyards - The amount promised has since decreased and possibly relocated also. 
.Public Sector Jobs
.Social Security
.Renewables
All promised. Non delivered.

attributes.action: Make it law that dog wardens must check lost Pet chips and inform owners at once
attributes.background: There are many cases of people phoning kennels about lost dogs to be told that the warden has not collected the dog it’s not there, then receiving a letter on the 6th day of it being there telling them to collect it, this isn't right the dog only has 7 days before council take ownership  PTS rehomed
attributes.additional_details: There are two cases that I'm aware of where dogs have been PTS before the owner had chance to rescue they had not been informed by dog warden/kennels even after ringing up and asking cases where owners have been looking for their dogs and they've been rehomed starting a debate about ownership and the original owners having to say goodbye to their best friend because they cant afford to fight in court People are turning to social media and volunteers to find and return dogs because its safer.

attributes.action: Change the law to get justice for unborn babies killed in the womb during RTA's
attributes.background: When I was 24 weeks pregnant, my son was tragically killed in the womb after I was involved in a major car crash. People who cause road traffic accidents that kill babies in the womb can’t be charged with “death by dangerous driving” as in the eyes of the law a baby in the womb is not a person.
attributes.additional_details: As my son was born after 24 weeks he was classed as stillborn. He has a birth certificate and a death certificate. On his death certificate, his cause of death was written as 'road traffic accident' by medical professionals and signed. It's now also been proven I suffered placenta abruption as a result of the impact of the crash on my bump. If he was 1 day old or 1 week old the driver could be charged! My son had his whole life ahead of him and will never get justice!

attributes.action: Pressure Donald Trump to not move the US embassy for Israel to Jerusalem.
attributes.background: The international community doesn't recognise Israel's right over the city. Other religious groups also have legitimate claims to Jerusalem. Trump's intention to move the US embassy should be condemned by the UK government.

attributes.action: Urge the FCA to cap repayments on rent-to-own and doorstep lending
attributes.background: The Sun is calling for a cap on the total cost of rent-to-own loans and doorstep lending at double the original item price or loan amount. This was introduced for payday loans in 2015 and the numbers of people struggling with unmanageable debts to those lenders has more than halved.
attributes.additional_details:
People on the lowest incomes, living in the poorest places, are paying a poverty premium - around 7 million people have resorted to high-cost credit. People whose wages or benefits don't stretch far enough need to borrow from rent-to-own or doorstep lenders to help pay for things such as an unexpected bill or to furnish their homes. These come with exorbitant rates of interest - more than 1,500% in some cases of doorstep lending. 
It's time to stop the credit rip-off.

attributes.action: Make independent inventory reporting of privately rented properties compulsory
attributes.background:
Independent inventory reporting of privately rented properties on an AST should be a mandatory requirement.

Independent inventories offer protection and help to reduce the number of deposit disputes.

Please support this petition and help us make the letting process more transparent for all.
attributes.additional_details:
As the Private Rented Sector now covers a fifth of all households (EHS 2015-16), it’s crucial that tenants and landlords abide by a fair move-in/move-out process.

Key figures:

- A third of 2,500 tenants admitted having their deposit withheld and 68% believed their landlord didn’t provide good enough reason to do so (Hillarys, 2017).

- 40% of students lose well over a third of their deposit when they rent privately, while 79% do not sign a photo inventory when they move in (Money.co.uk, 2016).

attributes.action: Fund and support a monument to the POLISH PILOT HEROES of the Battle of Britain.
attributes.background: Let’s build a 30 metre high dramatic memorial in Central London to the heroic Polish Pilots in the Battle of Britain 1940. Nor were the Poles invited to the British Victory Parade when the War ended. The proposed monument is a great opportunity to thank them for their sacrifice & dedication.
attributes.additional_details: IT’S THE POLES WHO WON IT! 303 POLISH SQUADRON: - Highest scoring in the whole RAF. - High scoring RAF Ace of Aces pilot. With 302 Polish Squadron shot down 60% of German planes on Battle of Britain Day. This decisive Polish contribution to victory needs to be known and celebrated.

attributes.action: The government must ring-fence mental health budgets.
attributes.background:
Mental health staff numbers are not increasing at anything like the rate the government claims. The government announced additional funding for mental health, but not all the money pledged is reaching the front line. The government must agree to ring-fence mental health budgets.

.
attributes.additional_details:
Two years ago, the government announced additional funding for mental health - £1.4 billion over five years to deliver the Five Year Forward View for Mental Health and £1.25 billion for the Future In Mind programme for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services. 
We know however that not all the money pledged is reaching the front line. Too many Clinical Commissioning Groups – the bodies that decide how money is spent locally – are using the money for other services.
#mentalhealthmatters

attributes.action: Increase School Funding to local authorities and Stop the Education Cuts.
attributes.background: Over the last two years schools have been forced to reduce the number of school support staff owing to unprecedented cuts in the Government support grant.Those taking the hardest cuts are school support staff who are either made redundant or have to do more by having extra duties without recognition
attributes.additional_details:
Schools should have more than the current funding settlement and the freedom to employ the right level of support staff appropriate to the needs of their pupils with the drive to improve education standards.
They are the backbone of our education system and should be treated with respect. They help the most vulnerable children and schools cannot function without them. As a consequence, many children would struggle and leave school without the qualifications and skills needed in adulthood.

attributes.action:
adrenaline pens to be available in public and food places. 
social awareness
attributes.background: With knowing how important and life saving adrenaline pens are though past and present experiences myself If I hadn't had my pen with me it could of been different, so what I'm asking you to do is change the law, with potentially life threatening allergic reactions on the rise safety is paramount.
attributes.additional_details: The reason I want adrenaline pens to be available in public and food places, one; i'm aiming to ask to help reduce the stigma of not carrying life saving adrenaline pens, two; we all forget the importance of things, three; if your newly diagnosed you won't always get an adrenaline pen straight away. Finally social awareness is needed along aside,training first aiders to administer adrenaline pens. This simple procedure could save many lives.

attributes.action: Universal Credit applicants to receive adequate payments throughout assessment.
attributes.background: Currently Universal Credit applicants can have no income for a minimum of 6 weeks after application. This causes hardship and distress and a legacy of debt and arrears. They need an income, not a loan. Citizens Advice report the wait for first Universal Credit payments can be as long as 10 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: Housing Associations and private landlords have the right to trigger eviction after 8 weeks of rent arrears. COSLA has found that in areas where full rollout of Universal Credit has taken place, the level of rent arrears is at least 2.5 times that of those areas still in receipt of housing benefit. Last year, foodbanks in areas of full Universal Credit rollout have seen a 16.85% average increase in referrals for emergency food, more than double the national average of 6.64%.
